option3: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

question: At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
option1: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
option2: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
option3: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

This sign means:
What does the pictured signal indicate?
option1: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
option3: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

question: This sign indicates that:
option1: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
option2: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
option3: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.

question: Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
option3: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

question: This sign means:
Passing on a two-lane, two-way road is not allowed:
option1: within 100 feet of an intersection or railroad crossing.

question: When two vehicles on different roadways reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time, the vehicle on the right should yield to the vehicle on the left.
What does this sign indicate?
option1: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
option2: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
option3: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
